p: Regarding the composition of the top-10, most effective blends, it is worth stressing that seven of them contained EO from Greek oregano, while another six included EO from Spanish oregano, but none of them contained pennyroyal or lemon balm. Indeed, the EOs of Spanish oregano (solution #5; IC 50: 55.9 ± 2.0 μg mL −1) and Greek oregano (solution #1; IC 60.7 ± 0.7 μg mL −1) were among the single-note EOs featured in the list of most effective EOs. With respect to bipartite composites of EOs ( Table 1), the most prominent one was a combination of Greek oregano with wild carrot (blend #10), followed by another three blends which also contained Greek oregano or Spanish oregano (blend #8, #11, #16). Only three tripartite composites were featured in the top-10 list ( Table 1), with all of them containing Greek oregano and Spanish oregano in combination with savoury (blend #31) or rosemary (blend #35) or wild carrot (blend #38).
